question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor finishes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris with a time under 9.63s, based on results provided by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD be terminated by the US government prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the question will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Is the US government going to terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's control over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the US government discontinue its contract allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a response of **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's authority over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), prior to August 3, 2024. If this does not take place, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the peak Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 4 and at most 6, as per the data provided by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

- The Philippines withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC.

- The PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the public" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without utilizing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as happened in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the standard web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be deemed a positive outcome if the branding or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

It will still be considered a favorable outcome if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (allowing users to submit queries to systems driven by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Will the full results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, be released by the Venezuelan electoral authority prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered affirmatively if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that, before 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any Venezuelan government body has disclosed results from the July 28, 2024 election that claim to represent 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Will the full results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, be released by the Venezuelan electoral authority prior to August 12, 2024?

para_P.body: This question will receive a Yes response if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that, prior to 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET) on Monday, August 12, 2024, any division of the Venezuelan government has publicly disclosed the election results from July 28, 2024, asserting to represent 100% of the votes cast, with details down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.body:

- association football

- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the answer will be **Yes** if the same NOC manages to win at least two of these competitions. 

The resolution of this question can occur as soon as it is evident which of these scenarios will take place (for instance, if neither team in the final of the last event has won any of the preceding competitions).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a voting process at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is ratified by a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, according to credible information.

para_P.body: This question will be regarded as answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement obtains endorsement via a vote by the close of 2024, according to data from trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Will there be a lethal assault executed by Iran inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information suggests that an attack linked to Iran, taking place within the territory of Israel, has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Will there be an additional debate for the Democratic party?
para_P.body: This will be YES if a debate takes place involving potential Democratic contenders (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be NO in every other scenario.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 presidential election?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 presidential election. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected prior to the 2024 election?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 presidential election. It will be deemed NO if no such debate takes place.

para_P.title: Will a subsequent presidential debate for the Democratic party occur prior to the 2024 election?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate takes place among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 presidential election. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is there going to be another presidential debate for the Democratic party before the 2024 election?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs between potential Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 presidential election. Resolves NO in all other scenarios.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapable under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and leads to the Vice President taking on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and results in the Vice President assuming the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not affect this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential role due to death, resignation, etc., is not taken into account. Additionally, Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is excluded from consideration.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before September?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or an appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities of his position" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not qualify. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden unfit before September?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority), implements Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and designates the Vice President as Acting President, prior to September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not pertain to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not taken into account. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to enforce the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a credible news source report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be deemed YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden formally announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news outlets, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed YES if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or individual remarks on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be considered N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden chooses to step down, will a credible news outlet announce it at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if a significant and reliable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the decision to step down with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden's formal announcement regarding the withdrawal via a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy sites, or personal comments on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not step down before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will be deemed "Yes" if Iran conducts a military strike on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will be resolved as "No".

For this market's purposes, a "military strike" refers to any forceful engagement by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile targets a weapons facility in Israel, the outcome will be "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible news sources. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures are excluded from the resolution criteria.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have been launched from Iranian soil, will be considered for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will be deemed "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will be resolved as "No".

For this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action undertaken by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons storage facility in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, air raids, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian soil will be counted for the resolution. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.body:
This market will be classified as "Yes" if Iran executes a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such military action takes place, the market will be resolved as "No".

In this context, a "military operation" signifies any aggressive action carried out by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile targets a weapons depot in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or supported by credible reports. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial strikes, naval attacks, or ground incursions. Cyber attacks, economic sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly recognized by the Islamic Republic of Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will be included in the resolution. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran launches a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 19, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

For the purpose of this market, a "military operation" is defined as any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, the market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible reports. para_P.title: Will Iran initiate military operations prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 20th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran engages in a military action within the borders, airspace, or maritime zones of Israel between July 30 and August 19, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such military actions occur, the market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, a "military action" is defined as any force utilized by Iran within Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas (for example, if an Iranian missile targets a military facility situated in Israel, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or widely reported by reputable sources. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial strikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber attacks, economic sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions executed by Iranian military forces that are explicitly recognized by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for the outcome of this market. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other presents a generic Democrat for their choice.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public sentiment frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat assessed in hypothetical scenarios is polling either ahead or within that margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater once both polls have concluded.

The method for calculating the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Other)). A YES result occurs if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result will be NO.

The polls and this query will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public sentiment consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in hypothetical scenarios is either leading or falls within the error margin. Are the responses from Manifold participants indicative of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

To determine the percentage of votes for Trump, the calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES response is given if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If it is not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will remain open until the specified closing time and will not resolve as N/A under any circumstances.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the most intense geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 5 but not surpassing 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the peak Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and does not exceed 6, as per the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will there be a peak geomagnetic storm with a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 5 but not surpassing 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and at most 6, as reported by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a significant geomagnetic storm occurring between July 17 and July 28, 2024, with a K-index ("Kp") that is greater than 5 but does not exceed 6?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not a factor in this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President, in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the duties and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not impact this question.

Circumstances such as Biden leaving the Presidential role due to death, resignation, etc., are not considered. Additionally, Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not relevant.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still very concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures combined would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not applicable. The activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment by Biden is not taken into account.

Context: A GOP lawmaker is urging Merrick Garland to enforce the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before September?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office through death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to September?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) officially activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before September 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Section 4 of the 25th Amendment be enacted to declare Biden unfit for office before September?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a YES response if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), formally enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and designates the Vice President as Acting President, prior to September 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not pertain to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not relevant. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered in this context.

Background: A Republican legislator has urged Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not applicable. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) utilizes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This is confirmed with a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President cannot carry out the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential position due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator is urging Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

The duration of the incapacity does not pertain to this question.

Considerations such as Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., are not included. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not taken into account.

Context: A GOP legislator has urged Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential responsibilities under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of performing the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated under the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his duties under the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President in conjunction with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.
